chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Fred Richardson

Defendant Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley in court.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by phone for Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense informs the Court of a breakdown in communication and requests to withdraw as counsel.  Court grants Defense's request to withdraw and schedules a status of counsel date.  State Public Defender's Office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-20-2022

Defendant Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD D. Sloan. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley in court in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned. Defense is unable to appear due to a personal matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. According to SPD the defendant needs to be interviewed to determine her eligibility for services. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Diamond Amiya Vanessa Riley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
